title: No request retry logic - failed API requests don't retry with backoff
No visible status indicator - users can't tell if OpenCode is connected and ready
Silent failures - errors only show in debug mode, server stderr discarded
Duplicate session management - session.lua and client._get_pooled_session overlap
No feedback during long operations - voice commands and completions lack progress indicators
Blocking operations freeze UI - io.popen and vim.loop.sleep block event loop
description:
## Problem
Multiple blocking operations freeze the Neovim UI:
- `io.popen` in server.lua:155,170 (health check curl - blocks up to 2s)
- `io.popen` in health.lua:15 (opencode --version check)
- `vim.loop.sleep(10)` in port.lua:45 (blocks event loop during retry)

Call chain: :OpenCodeStatus → is_running() → health_check() → io.popen BLOCKS

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Async HTTP Utility (utils.lua)
Add `M.async_curl(args, callback, opts)` using vim.fn.jobstart

### Phase 2: Server Module Refactor (server.lua)
- Add local state tracking: `server_healthy`, `health_check_timer`
- New async `M.health_check(callback)`
- Non-blocking `M.is_running()` returns cached state
- 30-second periodic health check timer
- New `M.refresh_status(callback)` for explicit refresh

### Phase 3: Port Module Fix (port.lua)
- Convert `find_free_port_with_retry` to async with callback
- Replace `vim.loop.sleep(10)` with timer-based retry

### Phase 4: Health Module Update (health.lua)
- Replace `io.popen` with `vim.fn.system()` for version check

### Phase 5: Main Module Updates (opencode.lua)
- `M.is_available()` uses cached state (instant)
- `M.status()` shows "Checking..." then updates with fresh state

### Files to Modify
- lua/opencode/utils.lua - add async_curl()
- lua/opencode/server.lua - async health checks, state tracking, periodic timer
- lua/opencode/port.lua - async find_free_port_with_retry
- lua/opencode/health.lua - replace io.popen with vim.fn.system
- lua/opencode.lua - update is_available(), status()

### UX Decisions (Confirmed)
- :OpenCodeStatus shows "Checking..." then updates with fresh state
- 30-second health check timer interval
- Server startup: keep 2s delay, make health check async
- Errors via vim.notify (visible in :messages)
- Target Neovim 0.9+, error on older versions
